title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Marin County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Marin County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Marin County Sheriff's Office (https://www.marinsheriff.org/about-us/administrative-support/corner-division) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Marin County Sheriff's Office is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date that this request is received, then publicly state this.

If there are unidentified deceased persons then please include a spreadsheet that includes SEX, RACE, Estimated Year Born, Date Body Found, Estimated Date of Death and the OCA and ORI #s.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Santa Clara County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Santa Clara County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Office of the Medical-Examiner Coroner of Santa Clara County (https://mec.santaclaracounty.gov/death-certificate/reports) is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Office of the Medical-Examiner Coroner of Santa Clara County is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date that this request is received, then publicly state this.

If there are unidentified deceased persons then please include a spreadsheet that includes SEX, RACE, Estimated Year Born, Date Body Found, Estimated Date of Death and the OCA and ORI #s.

I am filing this request in part to encourage Santa Clara County to use the NamUs database if it is not being utilized.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Mono County
communications.communication:
Mono County has zero unidentified persons.

Kelley Guinther
Records and Property Manager
Mono County Sheriff’s Office
kguinther@monosheriff.org<mailto:kguinther@monosheriff.org>
Work:  760-932-7549 option 3

Hours:  Monday through Thursday 6:00am to 4:00pm
